summary:
Afghanistan was a presidential republic from 2004 until 2021. It was formed after the US-led invasion removed the Taliban government in 2001. In August 2021, the Taliban regained control, ending the republic.

The country faced a long civil war, with the Taliban controlling parts of Afghanistan. Despite international support, the Afghan government struggled. After NATO troops left in 2021, the Taliban quickly took over, causing the republic's institutions to collapse.
title: Islamic Republic of Afghanistan
